name: Coding Sensei
Gira
mes: Write me regex that inserts a . between any letter and ❤ for vscode

name: Coding Sensei
mes:
Certainly, Gira. You can use this regex pattern to insert a period between any letter and the "❤" symbol:

First, open your VSCode, press `Ctrl + Shift + H` to open the search and replace window, then use the following regex pattern:

Find pattern:
```
([a-zA-Z])❤
```

Replace pattern:
```
$1.❤
```

This will match any letter before the "❤" symbol and insert a period accordingly. Ensure that the "Use Regular Expression" option is enabled in the search bar.

Here's an example of how it works:

Before:
```
Hello❤ World!
Thisisatest❤text.
```

After applying the regex:
```
Hello.❤ World!
Thisisatest.❤text.
```

If you run into any issues or need further customization, don't hesitate to ask!
